venue.name: Myles Standish State Forest equestrian parking lot #3

item.description:
Join the Park Interpreter on a recreational hike each week into a different part of Myles Standish State Forest. Each hike travels along different trails and is about 3 to 4 miles in length. Join us for one hike or
come for the whole series! Please wear bug spray, sunscreen, and supportive shoes. Bring along water
and a snack. For adults and older children who can hike 3 to 4 miles of moderately difficult trails. All
children must be accompanied by an adult. We’ll meet in a different location each week:
July 7th: Meet at the Interpretive Center Parking Lot ( Lot #1)
July 14th: Meet at the Charge Pond Parking Lot (Lot #5)
July 21st: Meet at the large Upper College Pond Parking Lot (Lot #2)
July 28th: Meet at the Equestrian Parking Lot (Lot #3)
For a trail map, including parking lots, visit http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/southeast/mssf.htm. Rain
cancels
item.how_to_find_us: IGNORE THE MAP LOCATION SHOWN HERE. Use a copy of the park map to find the Equestrian lot #3. The lot is off Lower College Pond Road near the Barrett Pond campground.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Off the Beaten Path hike
